summary: A re-imagining of Skyrim for a modern generation of gaming
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/PXh16Vk.png[/img]


When I set out to create an ENB preset, my intention was to re-imagine Skyrim as if it were built for a modern generation of gaming, thus the Modern Fantasy ENB was born. This is how I imagine Skyrim would look if it were developed during 2015 for Xbox One and Playstation 4.


[img]http://i.imgur.com/NOMHpAk.png[/img][/center] 

-Bright Days
-Bright Blue Skies
-Beautiful Night Skies
-Intense Depth of Field
-Intense God Rays
-Reflective Waters
-Water Depth (Objects appear darker the deeper they are submerged)
-Cloudy Waters, yet still visible underwaters
-Bleak, yet Ambient Caves & Dungeons
-Gray fogs, snow and rain storms
-Soft Shadows
-Adaptation (Camera view darkens if the game is too bright and it brightens if it's too dark)
-Ambient Occlusion


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/HQZ3o9i.png[/img][/center]

[center]Graphics Card: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750ti (2GB)
CPU: AMD FX-4100 Quad-Core 3.6GHz
RAM: 8GBs[/center]

These requirements are based off of my own rig. I play the game at max settings at 720p, and get an average of 30fps with this ENB; your performance may vary.

[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/qd0UJuL.png[/img][/center]

1. Download [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0266.htm]ENBSeries[/url]
2. Open with Winrar > WrapperVersion > Extract "d3d9.dll" and "enbhost.exe" to your Skyrim directory (the root folder with "TESV.exe" located in it)
3. Download [url=http://www.dev-c.com/skyrim/enbhelper/]ENBHelper[/url] and extract the "enbhelper.dll" to your Skyrim directory
4. Download my mod and extract the contents to your Skyrim DIrectory
5. Launch Skyrim and enjoy!


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/N5TQLaC.png[/img][/center]

[b]Climates of Tamriel[/b]: Upon using the default settings for CoT, days appear just fine in all weathers, however nights appear more brightly lit and warmer altogether. So I'm gonna call it only partially compatible, I'm sure with some jury rigging it'll look fine.

[b]Enhanced Lights and FX[/b]: Appears to be completely compatible, I've only tested it with default settings with no exteriors. Though I did notice some loss in performance, but that will vary from rig to rig.

[center][b]Please let me know if there are any issues with other mods![/b][/center]

[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/lpe9mwO.png[/img][/center]


[center][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/41076/?][img]http://i.imgur.com/OFI1PKb.jpg[/img][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/8655/?][img]http://i.imgur.com/Gmv0EyT.jpg[/img][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/60220/?][img]http://i.imgur.com/cSx20iF.jpg[/img][/url][/center]

Vainlash for the use of their lens flare texture
author: NjildaTheRed
